title: Tenure of office of members

content.text: (1) Every member of the House of Representatives shall vacate his seat in the House -
(a) at the next dissolution of Parliament after his election;
(b) if he ceases to be a citizen of Malta;
(c) if he absents himself from the sittings of the House for such period and in such circumstances as may be prescribed in the Standing Orders of the House;

(d) if he becomes a party to, or a partner with unlimited liability in a partnership or a director or manager of a company which is a party to, a contract with the Government of Malta being a contract of works or a contract for the supply of merchandise to be used in the service of the public, or if any partnership in which he is a partner with unlimited liability or any company of which he is a director or manager becomes a party to any such contract, or if he becomes a partner with unlimited liability in a partnership or a director or manager of a company that is a party to any such contract:

Provided that he shall not vacate his seat under the provisions of this paragraph if before becoming a party to, or partner with unlimited liability in a partnership which is a party to, or a director or manager of a company which is a party to, any such contract, or before, or as soon as practicable after, any partnership in which he is a partner with unlimited liability or any company of which he is a director or manager becomes a party to any such contract, he discloses to the Speaker the nature of the contract and his interest, or the interest of the partnership or company therein, and the House of Representatives by resolution exempts him from the provisions of this paragraph; or

(e) if any circumstances arise that, if he were not a member of the House of Representatives, would cause him to be disqualified for election thereto by virtue of paragraph (a), (e), (f) or (g) of sub-article (1) of article 50 of this Constitution.

(2) Parliament may provide for the imposition on any person who offers himself as a candidate at an election of members of the House of Representatives or for the imposition on any member of the House of such restrictions and conditions as it may consider appropriate to ensure that, in any case in which the post, office or emolument in question might influence a candidate or member of the House in the discharge of his duties or responsibilities as a candidate or member of the House or might involve him in a conflict of interest as a candidate or member of the House, the person shall not be selected to fill the post, office or emolument unless he has made such election or given such undertaking as Parliament may prescribe.

(3) Parliament may, in order to permit any person who has been selected to fill any post, office or emolument the holding of which would disqualify him for membership of the House of Representatives and who is about to proceed to take up such post, office or emolument, to continue for a limited period as a member of the House, exempt any such person from vacating his seat under the provisions of this article for such period as may be provided by Parliament in order to permit such person to order his affairs:
Provided that no such exemption shall permit any person to vote in the House after he shall have proceeded to take up such post, office or emolument.

crossReferences.description: Reference to disqualifications for membership of House of Representatives

notes: This article establishes when a member of the House of Representatives must vacate their seat, including upon dissolution of Parliament, loss of citizenship, absence, conflicting contracts with the government, or circumstances that would have disqualified them from being elected.
